SENT.plain: A 13-yr-old boy developed post-transplant liver tumor
At three yrs of age, this patient underwent a histocompatible sibling donor BMT for severe aplastic anemia, after a conditioning with antithymocyte globulin and cyclophosphamide
He became a HBV carrier after BMT
Stable mixed chimerism and mild thrombocytopenia, but no active hepatitis continued
At age 13, abdominal pain was a sign of massive tumor
Extremely high levels of alpha-fetoprotein indicated the clinical diagnosis of hepatoblastoma that might be the first report as post-BMT malignancy
The necropsy specimens revealed that the tumor was recipient cell-origin and showed the histopathological features of both hepatoblastoma and hepatocellular carcinoma
Prolonged mixed chimerism and hepatitis virus infection might induce a rare oncogenesis after non-irradiated conditioning
